Other than their majesty, intelligence and right to survival, Elephants are Africa’s gardeners and landscape engineers, planting seeds and creating critical habitat wherever they roam.

Other than their majesty, intelligence and right to survival, Elephants are Africa’s gardeners and landscape engineers, planting seeds and creating critical habitat wherever they roam.

Elephants are known to display a deep sensitivity and awareness of death and will return repeatedly to carcasses and skeletons of deceased herd members, running their trunks gently over their remains as though paying their respects.

settings.title: Our Initiatives save critically endangered wildlife from habitat loss & poaching.

settings.editor: Our mission is to secure a future for elephants and to sustain the beauty and ecological integrity of the places they live; to promote man’s delight in their intelligence and the diversity of their world, and to develop a tolerant relationship between the two.

settings.title: As of 2020, elephants face a high risk of extinction in the wild.

settings.editor: Even with Elephant numbers decreasing in recent years, conservation efforts are more successful than ever. See how our projects, actions and fundraisers are helping save thousands of Elephants every year.
